body.name: Enfamil Nutramigen Hypoallergenic Baby Formula, Lactose Free, Colic Relief from Cow's Milk Allergy Starts in 24 Hours, Brain Building Omega-3 DHA for Immune Support, 8 FL Oz (24 Count)
features: HELPS EASE YOUR LITTLE ONE’S COLIC: Delivers clinically proven relief when managing colic due to cow’s milk allergy for a happier, better-rested baby & mom​
GENTLE, FAST RELIEF: As early as the first feeding, many babies experience improvement within just 48 hours – a comforting solution for your little one​
NOURISHING BRAIN DEVELOPMENT: Nutramigen, a gentle, lactose-free formula, has omega-3 DHA, ARA, and choline to support your baby's growing brain​
IMMUNITY SUPPORT: Help your baby's immune system adapt to standard milk formula​
READY-TO-FEED AT ANY TIME: Convivence with complete nutrition for your baby​
TRUSTED BY PEDIATRICIANS*: Nutramigen is the #1 Trusted Hypoallergenic Formula Brand By Pediatricians*​
SNAP ELIGIBLE: Eligible to be purchased with Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP) benefits
SUBSCRIBE & SAVE: Choose Subscribe and Save for additional savings and convenience
body.description: Enfamil Nutramigen is a hypoallergenic formula proven to manage colic fast, often within 48 hours. If your baby has an allergy to the cow's milk protein in infant formula, Nutramigen contains both extensively hydrolyzed protein to manage colic fast. These two ingredients offer a more comprehensive approach working together to help babies feel better faster. The benefits of these two ingredients include: Hypoallergenic, easy-to-digest proteins, proven to promote skin health in infants through 18 months of age, proven to promote digestive system health within 1 week of use, effectively manages colic in 48 hours, promotes immune system balance. Nutramigen is also nutritionally balanced, lactose free, and has no added sucrose. †Studied before the addition of DHA and ARA. *Enfamil is the #1 pediatrician recommended brand of Infant Formula - QuintilesIMS, using the ProVoice Survey fielded from October 1, 2016 to September 30, 2017. **Due to cow's milk protein allergy

productInformation.value: #2,592 in Baby (See Top 100 in Baby) #6 in Liquid Baby Formula

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 28, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars SO WORTH THE MONEY
reviews.reviewText: This is gonna be really long but hoping it'll help other parents.Our boy is 8 weeks today and it's been HELL to say the least. From day 1 he has been extremely colicky, uncomfortable, crying 24/7, not gaining appropriate weight, would be awake for 8 plus hours at a time. I knew something was wrong and had went to the doctors multiple times. I was told he had acid reflux and he was put on medication as well as told to change formulas. I switched his formula 6 times. The medicine seemed to help for about a week but even that wasn't doing much. 5 days ago I called the doctor and said I wanted a different doctor(I had already seen 2 at this point) and said something is wrong and I want to know what it is. This doctor immediately said he had a milk protein allergy. She said reflux was common in babies with this allergy, as well as his mucous like diarrhea 15x a day. She told us to try nutramigen. I was VERY hesitant to switch formulas again and also to spend the money.Well, after about 12 hours he was seeming to be less uncomfortable. After 24 hours he was sleeping way longer at night. After 48 hours we had a completely different baby. Finally at 8 weeks he is no longer in pain. He is smiling, happy, playing, NAPPING, sleeping 2-3 hours longer at night. Only cries now when he is hungry or needs to burp. I wish we would've been told this sooner and started this sooner that is my only regret.

reviews.reviewText: Our doctor calls this formula liquid gold. It’s expensive. It smells and tastes pretty bad but it’s the only thing that works for our baby.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 6, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Thank goodness for Nutramigen!
reviews.reviewText: This is the only formula my preemie granddaughter could tolerate. The powder worked better for her but this was convenient when the powder wasn't available. The smell of this formula is rather stinky but the fact it was tolerated so well made that easy to overlook.

reviews.reviewText: My little one uses this formula because he has tummy issues! The price for this is lower than what I pay in stores

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 14, 2023
reviews.reviewText: This is my baby’s favorite. There’s nothing wrong with it except that it’s expensive.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 10, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars If you’re reading this hang in there!
reviews.reviewText: First of all congratulations on your baby! If you are extremely exhausted and full of anxiety DON’T WORRY, you will get through this! There’s nothing quite like being totally sleep deprived with a new baby that screams and throws up after every meal. People who say “oh weird, our baby never cried and always went right to sleep after eating”… I have one thing to say to you ma’ams and sirs: YOU SIT ON A THRONE OF LIES. Just kiiiiddding! That sounds amazing, but wasn’t the case for us. We tried about 7 different kinds of formula and she had the same reaction to all of them - obvious discomfort, gas, screaming, and vomiting after a meal. Although the ingredients in this one aren’t the best (corn and soy products) we got to the point of just being grateful to find something she could keep down and happily handle. This is pretty much the story of parenting, take wins where you can get them!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 27, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Solved my baby’s digestion issues
reviews.reviewText: My six week old had blood in his diaper and was grunting from discomfort all day and night. I was breastfeeding and subsequently cut out dairy and soy from my diet Ten days later, he was still grunting. The pediatrician recommended Alimentum, but it proved to be too thick for my baby who had a hard time swallowing it. The grunting and discomfort continued. We then tried Nutramigen (liquid), and within a few days, my baby stopped grunting altogether, started sleeping more and becoming happier. If your baby is experiencing grunting or digestive discomfort when they are trying to pass gas (or in our case, all the time), then this may be the formula for you. While many people said “he’ll grow out of it,” I knew that something was off and have seen a 180 degree difference. I’m so grateful that he feels better!
